text: Previously , we have shown that <extra_id_0> TAL1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and the LIM-only protein gene ( LMO ) are regularly coactivated in T-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia ( T-ALL ) .
This observation is likely to relate to the findings that <extra_id_0> TAL1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and LMO are highly synergistic in T-cell tumorigenesis in double - transgenic mice .

To understand the molecular mechanisms of functional synergy between <extra_id_0> TAL1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and LMO in tumorigenesis and transcriptional regulation , we tried to identify downstream target genes regulated by <extra_id_0> TAL1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and LMO by a subtractive PCR method .

One of the isolated genes , that for <extra_id_0> retinaldehyde dehydrogenase 2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> RALDH2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) , was regularly expressed in most of the T-ALL cell lines that coexpressed <extra_id_0> TAL1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and LMO .

text: The <extra_id_0> RALDH2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transcripts in T-ALL were , however , mostly initiated within the second intron .

Promoter analysis revealed that a GATA site in a cryptic promoter in the second intron was essential and sufficient for the <extra_id_0> TAL1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - and LMO - dependent transcriptional activation , and <extra_id_0> GATA3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> binds to this site .

In addition , forced expression of <extra_id_0> GATA3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> potentiated the induction of <extra_id_0> RALDH2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> by <extra_id_0> TAL1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and LMO , and these three factors formed a complex in vivo .
